pr_title: ISPN-1103 Remove deprecated Persistence SPI methods and interfaces

timeline.message: ISPN-1103 Remove deprecated Persistence SPI methods and interfaces
ISPN-1103 Remove deprecated Persistence SPI methods and interfaces

timeline.bodyText: This isn't correct as the segments are no longer used anymore. We should make this not have a default imo.
timeline.author: wburns
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -212,41 +163,10 @@ default boolean delete(int segment, Object key) { * @param fetchValue whether the value should be included in the marshalled entry * @param fetchMetadata whether the metadata should be included in the marshalled entry * @return a publisher that will provide the entries from the store that map to the given segments - * @implSpec The default implementation falls back to invoking {@link #publishEntries(Predicate, boolean, - * boolean)}. - * @deprecated since 10.0, please us {@link #entryPublisher(Predicate, boolean, boolean)} instead. - */ - @Deprecated - default Publisher> publishEntries(IntSet segments, Predicate filter, boolean fetchValue, - boolean fetchMetadata) { - return publishEntries(filter, fetchValue, fetchMetadata); - } - - /** - * Publishes all entries from this store. The given publisher can be used by as many {@link - * org.reactivestreams.Subscriber}s as desired. Entries are not retrieved until a given Subscriber requests them from - * the {@link org.reactivestreams.Subscription}. - *

- * If fetchMetadata is true this store must guarantee to not return any expired entries. - *

- * The segments here must be adhered to and the entries published must not include any that don't belong to - * the provided segments. - *

- * This method is not invoked invoked when the store is not configured to be {@link StoreConfiguration#segmented()}. - * {@link StoreConfiguration#segmented()}. - * - * @param segments the segments that the keys of the entries must map to. Always non null. - * @param filter a filter on the keys of the entries that if passed will allow the given entry to be returned - * from the publisher - * @param fetchValue whether the value should be included in the marshalled entry - * @param fetchMetadata whether the metadata should be included in the marshalled entry - * @return a publisher that will provide the entries from the store that map to the given segments - * @implSpec The default implementation falls back to invoking {@link #publishEntries(IntSet, Predicate, boolean, - * boolean)}. */ default Publisher> entryPublisher(IntSet segments, Predicate filter, boolean fetchValue, boolean fetchMetadata) { - return Flowable.fromPublisher(publishEntries(segments, filter, fetchValue, fetchMetadata)); + return entryPublisher(filter, fetchValue, fetchMetadata);

replies.bodyText: This follows the same principle as all of the other default methods, revert to using non-segmented method if no segmented implementations exist. Should we remove those default implemenations? Or keep them and be consistent?
replies.author: ryanemerson

replies.bodyText: IMO there's no point in having any default implementation, either the store is segmented and it can implement all the methods, or it's not really segmented and it shouldn't implement SegmentedAdvancedLoadWriteStore.
replies.author: danberindei

replies.bodyText: I agree, unless @wburns has a scenario in mind where the non-segmented defaults are a good fit?
replies.author: ryanemerson

replies.bodyText: Nope, that is exactly what I was going for (remove the default impl).
replies.author: wburns

timeline.bodyText: Adios! This class was always so dirty feeling to me.
timeline.author: wburns

timeline.message: ISPN-1103 Remove deprecated Persistence SPI methods and interfaces

timeline.author: wburns
wburns

timeline.message:
ISPN-1103 Remove deprecated Persistence SPI methods and interfaces

- Remove SegmentedAdvancedLoadWriteStore default methods
- Remove redundant StreamingMarshallerBridge

- Remove SegmentedAdvancedLoadWriteStore default methods
- Remove redundant StreamingMarshallerBridge
